note.p: Career: Assistant to Edward Forbes (FRS 1845); Surgeon and Geologist to a Government expedition to western Canada, travelling from Lake Superior to Vancouver (1857-1860); discovered 'Hector's Pass' across the Rocky Mountains; Geologist to the Provincial Government of Otago, New Zealand (1861); Director, Geological Survey of New Zealand.
References: Robin J H Clark and Michael J Kelly, 'New Zealand, New Zealanders and the Royal Society' in NR 1994 vol 48 pp 263-281
R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
